Dear All,

I've been using Mixmaster to analyze results from some batch rea=
ctor
simulations, and I have a few observations/questions about Mixmaster..=
.

1) In the reactions frame, the column labeled Kp looks to contain
values=
 for Kc (i.e. kf/kr). Is it Kc or Kp?

2) Again in the reactions frame, the=
 Rev ROP column contains strange
and often negative values for me. The valu=
es in the Fwd ROP column
look fine to me. Does the Rev ROP column contain t=
he reverse rate
constant times the concentrations of the products, i.e. qre=
v =3D
krev*[P1][P2]...[Pn]? Is there a bookkeeping reason why these would b=
e
negative?

3) When I click the "Concentration" radio button in the Compos=
ition
frame, I get the following warning:

Exception in Tkinter callback
Tr=
aceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Python24\lib\lib-tk\Tkinter.py"=
, line 1345, in __call__
    return self.func(*args)
  File "C:\Python24\li=
b\site-packages\MixMaster\CompositionFrame.py",
line 91, in show
    mf.com=
p =3D mix.concentrations()
AttributeError: Mix instance has no attribute 'c=
oncentrations'

I added a little method called concentrations() to the Mix =
class that
seems to fix this, but this is probably dangerous because I real=
ly
don't know what I'm doing.

    def concentrations(self):
        return=
 self._moles/self.totalMoles()*self.g.molarDensity()


Thanks very much. Ca=
ntera and this user group have been very helpful to
my research.

Best,
Pau=
l
